page.title: 08RAIL SERVICE - BROUGH
page.content: Brough is a main line station serving a large area of North Humberside. It was opened in 1840 as a 2_line track, expanded to a 4_line, but has now reverted to 2 lines. Out of 9l0 passenger trains passing through daily, only one train does not stop. There is now little freight transport _ approximately 10 goods trains daily. The former coal and freight depot adjoining Brough station has been closed down. 50% of the total weekly revenue, that is approximately Â£6,000, comes from workers commuting to British Aerospace. Special trains carry workers from Hull to Brough and then go no further. From the opposite direction, trains bring in workers, whose places are refilled at Brough by passengers going to work in Hull. There is one manually operated signal box, also a level crossing.
